examples.text: He walked into the room, **closely followed** by the rest of the family.
streets of closely packed terraced houses
The country's economy remains **closely tied to** oil.

definitions.definition: in a way that shows you are very involved in the work or activities of somebody else, usually seeing and talking to them regularly

examples.text: The organization **works closely** with customers in nearly 100 countries.
The Royal Navy was **closely involved** in the early development of wireless technology.
They collaborated **closely together** for the next four years
The government has **looked closely at** the arguments for and against a change in the law.
We will be **closely monitoring** the situation.

definitions.definition: in a way that is very similar to somebody/something else

examples.text: She **closely resembled** her mother at the same age.
It was an exciting game between two **closely matched** teams.

definitions.definition: won or likely to be won by only a small amount or distance
with little or no space in between
cut very short, near to the skin

examples.text: He had a closely shaved head and a small, neat beard.
